perturbation.original_text: 1.11 "Term" means the period of time commencing on the Effective Date and continuing thereafter indefinitely until this Agreement is terminated pursuant to Section 10 below.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.11 "Term" means the period of time commencing on the Effective Date and continuing thereafter for a period of one year, unless terminated earlier pursuant to Section 10 below.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of "Term" specifies an indefinite duration, continuing until termination under Section 10. The modified definition limits the term to one year initially, contradicting the indefinite continuation.

perturbation.original_text: 10.1 Inktomi may terminate this Agreement without cause upon one year's prior written notice, provided that such notice may not be given prior to the second anniversary of the Launch Date.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.1 Inktomi may terminate this Agreement without cause upon thirty (30) days' prior written notice, provided that such notice may be given at any time after the Effective Date.
perturbation.explanation: Original Section 10.1 states that Inktomi must provide one year's notice for termination without cause, and that such notice can't be given prior to the second anniversary of launch. The new text changes the termination notice to thirty days and removes the 2-year restriction, thus the clause implies Inktomi may terminate as early as 30 days after Effective Date.

perturbation.original_text: 12.3 This Agreement shall be construed, enforced, performed and in all respects governed by and in accordance with the laws in the State of Washington. In any action or suit to enforce any right or remedy under this Agreement the prevailing party shall be entitled to recover its reasonable attorneys' fees and costs.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.3 This Agreement shall be construed, enforced, performed and in all respects governed by and in accordance with the laws in the State of Washington. In any action or suit to enforce any right or remedy under this Agreement, each party shall bear its own attorneysâ€™ fees and costs, regardless of the outcome of the litigation.
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows the prevailing party to recover attorneys' fees and costs. The changed text mandates that each party bears their own costs regardless of who wins, directly contradicting the original provision.
